tmpls.name: Card 1

fields:
Purpose: Split text into meaningful units for processing
Challenges: Punctuation, contractions, out-of-vocabulary words
Modern: Subword tokenization (BPE, SentencePiece)
Benefit: Balance between vocabulary size and coverage
What is the difference between stemming and lemmatization?

Stemming: Remove suffixes using rules (faster, cruder)
Lemmatization: Reduce to dictionary form using morphology
Example: "running" → "run" (stem) vs "running" → "run" (lemma)
Trade-off: Speed vs accuracy
What are stop words and when should you remove them?

Definition: Common words like "the", "is", "and"
Remove when: Focus on content words, reduce noise
Keep when: Syntax matters, phrase detection, sentiment
Context: "not good" vs "good" - "not" is crucial

Definition: Assign grammatical categories to words
Tags: Noun, verb, adjective, adverb, etc.
Uses: Parsing, NER, information extraction
Challenge: Ambiguous words ("book" as noun vs verb)

Definition: Identify and classify named entities in text
Types: Person, location, organization, date, money
Approaches: Rule-based, ML-based, deep learning
Applications: Information extraction, question answering
